2.text: Combine the rice with 4 cups (946 mL) of milk in a non-stick pot.

3.text: Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat.

4.text: Reduce the heat to low and cover the pot.

5.text: Simmer the mixture over low heat for about 20-25 minutes, stirring twice.

6.text: Stir in sweetener to taste, 1/4 tsp (1 g) of salt, and any other flavors you want to add.

7.text: Cook the mixture for 5 more minutes over low heat.

8.text: Combine equal parts of cooked rice and milk in a non-stick pot.

9.text: Bring the rice and milk to a boil over medium-high heat.

10.text: Turn the heat down to medium-low once the mixture begins to boil.

11.text: Stir in sweetener to taste and 1/4 tsp (1 g) of salt.

12.text: Add any other flavoring ingredients you want to and stir them in thoroughly.

13.text: Simmer the mixture over medium-low heat for at least 15 minutes.

14.text: Add warm ground spices for a classic flavor.

15.text: Stir in a spoonful of citrus zest if you want brighter flavors.

16.text: Mix in 1 spoonful of cocoa powder to make a chocolate rice and milk pudding.

17.text: Add dried fruits or nuts if you want more flavor and texture.

18.text: Pour a splash of sweet liquor into the pudding if you want an adult version.

19.text: Squeeze in a few drops of a liquid flavor extract to add additional flavors.
